snippet: The entire process, which officials said they hoped would begin within the next two weeks, would take roughly 90 days to complete, allowing for weather and other factors.
abstract: American military ship Cape Ray, part of maritime reserve fleet in Portsmouth, Va, is being readied to collect 700 tons of Syria's lethal chemical weapons and destroy them at sea; entire process, which officials say they hope will begin within the next two weeks, will take roughly 90 days to complete, allowing for weather and other factors.
lead_paragraph: The entire process, which officials said they hoped would begin within the next two weeks, would take roughly 90 days to complete, allowing for weather and other factors.

headline.main: U.S. Military Ship Readied for Mission to Destroy Syria’s Chemical Weapons
